title: Overnight Blueberry French Toast Recipe
description: This make-ahead blueberry French toast casserole is easy to prep the night before and bake in the morning for a pleasing holiday breakfast or brunch.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Breakfast and Brunch French Toast Recipes Overnight Blueberry French Toast 4.6 (2,262) 1,744 Reviews 362 Photos This blueberry French toast casserole is made the night before and baked in the morning for a very delicious holiday breakfast or brunch. It's bursting with fresh blueberries, and covered with a rich blueberry sauce to make it one-of-a-kind! Submitted by KARAN1946 Updated on October 2, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 362 362 362 362 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 55 mins Additional Time: 8 hrs 30 mins Total Time: 9 hrs 40 mins Servings: 10 Yield: 1 (9x13-inch) casserole Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 10 servings French Toast Casserole: 12 slices day-old bread, cut into 1-inch cubes 2 (8 ounce) packages cream cheese, cut into 1-inch cubes 1 cup fresh blueberries 12 large eggs, beaten 2 cups milk 1 teaspoon vanilla extract ⅓ cup maple syrup Blueberry Sauce: 1 cup white sugar 1 cup water 2 tablespoons cornstarch 1 cup fresh blueberries 1 tablespoon butter Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Prepare casserole: Lightly grease a 9x13-inch baking dish. Arrange 1/2 of the bread cubes in the dish and top with cream cheese cubes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Sprinkle blueberries over the cream cheese, then top with remaining bread cubes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Whisk eggs, milk, vanilla extract, and syrup together in a large bowl until well-combined; pour over the bread cubes. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Remove casserole from the refrigerator about 30 minutes before baking. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Bake casserole in the preheated oven, covered, for 30 minutes. Uncover, and continue baking until center is firm and surface is lightly browned, about 25 to 30 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Meanwhile, prepare blueberry sauce: Mix sugar, water, and cornstarch together in a medium saucepan; bring to a boil and cook, stirring constantly, 3 to 4 minutes. Stir in blueberries, reduce heat to low, and simmer until all the blueberries burst, about 10 minutes. Stir in butter. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve portions of casserole on plates and pour warm syrup over top. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 5,379 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 485 Calories 25g Fat 52g Carbs 15g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 10 Calories 485 % Daily Value * Total Fat 25g 32% Saturated Fat 13g 67% Cholesterol 279mg 93% Sodium 451mg 20% Total Carbohydrate 52g 19% Dietary Fiber 1g 5% Total Sugars 33g Protein 15g 30% Vitamin C 3mg 3% Calcium 180mg 14% Iron 3mg 17% Potassium 282mg 6% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Overnight Blueberry French Toast 01 of 362 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 362 Photo by  CyanSyrup8866 12/24/2024 I tweaked this recipe. I substituted sugar for sweetened condensed milk (1 small can) and the milk for evaporated milk. Used 12 eggs, not as much cream cheese but did add either rasberry or blueberry preserves. I placed a dollop of preserves randomly throughout the casserole. Prepped the sauce, again either rasberries or blueberries, added whipped cream and drizzled the saice on top of the whipped cream.It was FABULOUS. 03 of 362 Photo by  TrustyNori3120 04/18/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort Family favorite Edit: I made it in February, 2024. I used gluten-free dairy-free bread and substituted the cream cheese with a non-dairy plant-based product. Since I made the bread, it took more time, but worth every minute. Blueberries were in every bite making an explosion of flavor. Thank you for the inspiration.I will make it for Christmas morning this year. 04 of 362 Photo by  lutzflcat 02/10/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort Crowd-pleaser Family favorite This would be a total breakfast indulgence for me the way it’s written, so I did try to lighten it a bit by using Egg Beaters for the eggs, Truvia for the sugar, and reduced fat cream cheese. And that worked out great with no sacrifice to flavor. The video shows pressing down on the bread cubes before moving to the fridge, and that’s a great idea. That will help moisten ALL of the bread, not just the bottom. Only thing I would change is cutting both the bread and the cream cheese into a little smaller cubes next time. I lucked out and bought some of the sweetest blueberries I’ve ever had which made an amazing sauce. What a treat, simply outstanding, and definitely would make again. 05 of 362 Photo by  natelborgs 01/17/2024 I made a half recipe for our small family on a snowy Michigan morning and we loved it. Thank you! 06 of 362 Photo by  Pamela 01/03/2024 I made this for Christmas Eve brunch and New Years Day brunch and it was a huge hit! I followed a lot of the suggestions of CLARRY32 which were great! I used Italian bread and extra blueberries as well. This will be a staple for brunches from now on! 07 of 362 Photo by  Sarah Bear 12/12/2023 I made this a couple of years ago for our Christmas party. I made it again this year for the party and EVERY SINGLE person wanted the recipe. It's absolutely delicious! I did however tweak it a bit. I used French bread rather than Italian and added some powdered sugar and cinnamon to the egg mixture. My husband devoured the little bit that was left over from the party and asked me to make it again. This will be one of my "go to" recipes for sure!Made this again this year I did it a little differently this time. I used the blueberry sauce and poured it on both layers before I baked it. Then made extra to go on top after it was cooked. I got so many compliments. My husband said that it was exquisite! 08 of 362 Photo by  AmberStove1294 10/24/2022 Simple & easy recipe! I actually made this for my annual family breakfast and everyone loved it including myself, as there weren’t any left! I will definitely be making this again I may even try it with a different fruit even though the blueberries add the perfect amount of tartness. 09 of 362 Photo by  coachmattwagner 09/23/2022 The recipe was OK. It needs a little salt, and I used a fresh bakery loaf of sourdough bread. I also doubled the blueberry syrup and added a little lemon to it. After reading the comments, 10 eggs is plenty. 10 of 362 Photo by  Christy Nicole 06/29/2022 WOW! What an amazing recipe! I made this for a brunch I was hosting and everyone loved it! The blueberry topping made this dish in my opinion. I also added about 2 tsp of cinnamon, but followed everything else exactly as it said. Will definitely be making again! 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Overnight Blueberry French Toast Casserole 100 Ratings Strawberry French Toast Casserole 133 Ratings Stuffed Blueberry Toast 24 Ratings Raspberry Cheesecake Stuffed French Toast 148 Ratings Cinnamon Raisin Stuffed French Toast 31 Ratings Orange Pecan French Toast 431 Ratings Blueberry French Toast Casserole 5 Ratings Strawberry Cheesecake French Toast 228 Ratings Blueberry French Toast 311 Ratings Overnight Asparagus Mushroom Strata 173 Ratings Almond French Toast 113 Ratings Strawberry Pie 1,303 Ratings No-Bake Greek Yogurt Cheesecake 1 Rating Chef John's Asparagus Souffle 55 Ratings Patriotic French Toast 15 Ratings Blueberry Strata Recipe 70 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
